00048 /***********************
00049  * Basic I/O  Function *
00050  ***********************/
00051  
00052 uint16   IINCHIP_READ(uint32 addr)
00053 {
00054  #if (__DEF_IINCHIP_ADDRESS_MODE__ == __DEF_IINCHIP_DIRECT_MODE__)   
00055       return (*((vuint16*)addr));
00056  #else
00057       vuint16  data;  
00058       IINCHIP_CRITICAL_SECTION_ENTER(); 
00059       *((vuint16*)IDM_AR) = (uint16)addr;
00060       data = *((vuint16*)IDM_DR);   
00061       IINCHIP_CRITICAL_SECTION_EXIT();
00062       return data;
00063  #endif
00064 }
00065 void     IINCHIP_WRITE(uint32 addr,uint16 data)
00066 {
00067 #if (__DEF_IINCHIP_ADDRESS_MODE__ == __DEF_IINCHIP_DIRECT_MODE__)   
00068       (*((vuint16*)addr)) = data;
00069 #else
00070       IINCHIP_CRITICAL_SECTION_ENTER();
00071       *((vuint16*)IDM_AR) = addr;
00072       *((vuint16*)IDM_DR) = data;   
00073       IINCHIP_CRITICAL_SECTION_EXIT();
00074 #endif   
00075 }

00082 {
00083    *((vint16*)MR) = val;

00114 void     getSHAR(uint8 * addr)
00115 {
00116    addr[0] = (uint8)(IINCHIP_READ(SHAR)>>8);
00117    addr[1] = (uint8)IINCHIP_READ(SHAR);
00118    addr[2] = (uint8)(IINCHIP_READ(SHAR2)>>8);
00119    addr[3] = (uint8)IINCHIP_READ(SHAR2);
00120    addr[4] = (uint8)(IINCHIP_READ(SHAR4)>>8);
00121    addr[5] = (uint8)IINCHIP_READ(SHAR4);
00122 }
00123 void     setSHAR(uint8 * addr)
00124 {
00125    IINCHIP_WRITE(SHAR,(((uint16)addr[0])<<8)+addr[1]);
00126    IINCHIP_WRITE(SHAR2,((uint16)addr[2]<<8)+addr[3]);
00127    IINCHIP_WRITE(SHAR4,((uint16)addr[4]<<8)+addr[5]);
00128 }

00314 uint8    getSn_IR(SOCKET s)
00315 {
00316    #ifdef __DEF_IINCHIP_INT__    // In case of using ISR routine of iinchip
00317       return SOCK_INT[s];
00318    #else                         // In case of processing directly
00319       return (uint8)IINCHIP_READ(Sn_IR(s));
00320    #endif   
00321 }
00322 void     setSn_IR(SOCKET s, uint8 ir)
00323 {
00324    #ifdef __DEF_IINCHIP_INT__    // In case of using ISR routine of iinchip
00325       SOCK_INT[s] = SOCK_INT[s] & ~(ir);
00326    #else                         // In case of processing directly
00327       IINCHIP_WRITE(Sn_IR(s),ir);
00328    #endif   
00329 }

00331 
00332 /* SOCKET information */
00333 
00334 uint8    getSn_SSR(SOCKET s)
00335 {
00336    uint8 ssr, ssr1;
00337    ssr = (uint8)IINCHIP_READ(Sn_SSR(s));     // first read
00338 
00339    while(1)
00340    {
00341       ssr1 = (uint8)IINCHIP_READ(Sn_SSR(s)); // second read
00342       if(ssr == ssr1) break;                 // if first == sencond, Sn_SSR value is valid.
00343       ssr = ssr1;                            // if first <> second, save second value into first.
00344    }
00345    return ssr;
00346 }
00347 
00348 void     getSn_DHAR(SOCKET s, uint8* addr)
00349 {
00350    addr[0] = (uint8)(IINCHIP_READ(Sn_DHAR(s))>>8);
00351    addr[1] = (uint8)IINCHIP_READ(Sn_DHAR(s));
00352    addr[2] = (uint8)(IINCHIP_READ(Sn_DHAR2(s))>>8);
00353    addr[3] = (uint8)IINCHIP_READ(Sn_DHAR2(s));
00354    addr[4] = (uint8)(IINCHIP_READ(Sn_DHAR4(s))>>8);
00355    addr[5] = (uint8)IINCHIP_READ(Sn_DHAR4(s));
00356 }

00359 {
00360    IINCHIP_WRITE(Sn_DHAR(s),  ((uint16)(addr[0]<<8)) + addr[1]);
00361    IINCHIP_WRITE(Sn_DHAR2(s), ((uint16)(addr[2]<<8)) + addr[3]);
00362    IINCHIP_WRITE(Sn_DHAR4(s), ((uint16)(addr[4]<<8)) + addr[5]);
00363 }

00410 void     setSn_KPALVTR(SOCKET s, uint8 time)
00411 {
00412    uint16 keepalive=0;
00413    keepalive = (IINCHIP_READ(Sn_KPALVTR(s)) & 0x00FF) + ((uint16)time<<8);
00414    IINCHIP_WRITE(Sn_KPALVTR(s),keepalive);
00415 }

00417 uint32   getSn_TX_WRSR(SOCKET s)
00418 {
00419    uint32 tx_write_size=0;
00420    tx_write_size = IINCHIP_READ(Sn_TX_WRSR(s));
00421    tx_write_size = (tx_write_size << 16) + IINCHIP_READ(Sn_TX_WRSR2(s));
00422    return tx_write_size;
00423 }
00424 void     setSn_TX_WRSR(SOCKET s, uint32 size)
00425 {
00426    IINCHIP_WRITE(Sn_TX_WRSR(s), (uint16)(size >> 16));
00427    IINCHIP_WRITE(Sn_TX_WRSR2(s), (uint16)size);
00428 }
00429 
00430 uint32   getSn_TX_FSR(SOCKET s)
00431 {
00432    uint32 free_tx_size=0;
00433    uint32 free_tx_size1=0;
00434    while(1)
00435    {
00436       free_tx_size = IINCHIP_READ(Sn_TX_FSR(s));                           // read                                       
00437       free_tx_size = (free_tx_size << 16) + IINCHIP_READ(Sn_TX_FSR2(s));                                                       
00438       if(free_tx_size == free_tx_size1) break;                             // if first == sencond, Sn_TX_FSR value is valid.                                                          
00439       free_tx_size1 = free_tx_size;                                        // save second value into first                                                   
00440    }                                                                       
00441    return free_tx_size;                                                    
00442 }                                                                          
00443 
00444 uint32   getSn_RX_RSR(SOCKET s)
00445 {
00446    uint32 received_rx_size=0;
00447    uint32 received_rx_size1=1;
00448    while(1)
00449    {
00450       received_rx_size = IINCHIP_READ(Sn_RX_RSR(s));
00451       received_rx_size = (received_rx_size << 16) + IINCHIP_READ(Sn_RX_RSR2(s)); // read                                       
00452       if(received_rx_size == received_rx_size1) break;                                                                         
00453       received_rx_size1 = received_rx_size;                                      // if first == sencond, Sn_RX_RSR value is valid.
00454    }                                                                             // save second value into first                
00455    return received_rx_size;   
00456 }

00515 
00516 /* Initialization & Interrupt request routine */
00517 
00518 void     iinchip_init(void)
00519 {
00520    *((uint16*)MR) = MR_RST;
00521    wait_10ms(20);
00522    #if (__DEF_IINCHIP_ADDRESS_MODE__ == __DEF_IINCHIP_INDIRECT_MODE__)
00523       *((vint16*)MR) |= MR_IND;
00524       #ifdef __DEF_IINCHIP_DBG__        
00525               printf("MR value is %04x\r\n",*((vuint16*)MR));
00526       #endif    
00527    #endif
00528 }
00529 
00530 //This statement is commented for using 'Doxygen'.
00531 //#ifdef __DEF_IINCHIP_INT__ 
00536 void     iinchip_irq(void)
00537 {
00538    uint16 int_val;
00539    uint16 idx;
00540    IINCHIP_CRITICAL_SECTION_ENTER();
00541    // M_01052008 : replaced '==' with '='
00542    //while(int_val == IINCHIP_READ(IR))  // process all interrupt    
00543    while((int_val = IINCHIP_READ(IR)))  // process all interrupt 
00544    {          
00545       for(idx = 0 ; idx < MAX_SOCK_NUM ; idx++)
00546       {
00547          if (int_val & IR_SnINT(idx))  // check the SOCKETn interrupt
00548          {
00549             SOCK_INT[idx] |= (uint8)IINCHIP_READ(Sn_IR(idx)); // Save the interrupt stauts to SOCK_INT[idx]
00550             IINCHIP_WRITE(Sn_IR(idx),(uint16)SOCK_INT[idx]);  // Clear the interrupt status bit of SOCKETn
00551          }
00552       }
00553       
00554       if (int_val & (IR_IPCF << 8))    // check the IP conflict interrupt
00555       {
00556          printf("IP conflict : %04x\r\n", int_val);
00557       }
00558       if (int_val & (IR_DPUR << 8))    // check the unreachable destination interrupt
00559       {
00560          printf("INT Port Unreachable : %04x\r\n", int_val);
00561          printf("UIPR : %d.%d.%d.%d\r\n", (uint8)(IINCHIP_READ(UIPR)>>8),
00562                                           (uint8)IINCHIP_READ(UIPR),
00563                                           (uint8)(IINCHIP_READ(UIPR2)>>8),
00564                                           (uint8)IINCHIP_READ(UIPR2));
00565          printf("UPORTR : %04x\r\n", IINCHIP_READ(UPORTR));
00566       }
00567       IINCHIP_WRITE(IR, int_val & 0xFF00);
00568    }
00569    IINCHIP_CRITICAL_SECTION_EXIT();
00570 }
00571 //This statement is commented for using 'Doxygen'.
00572 //#endif 
00573 
00574 
00575 /* Internal memory operation */
00576  
00577 uint8    sysinit(uint8* tx_size, uint8* rx_size)
00578 {
00579    uint16 i;
00580    uint16 ssum=0,rsum=0;
00581    uint mem_cfg = 0;
00582    
00583    for(i=0; i < MAX_SOCK_NUM; i++)
00584    {
00585       if(tx_size[i] > 64)
00586       {
00587       #ifdef __DEF_IINCHIP_DBG__
00588          printf("Illegal Channel(%d) TX Memory Size.\r\n",i);
00589       #endif
00590          return 0;
00591       }
00592       if(rx_size[i] > 64)
00593       {
00594       #ifdef __DEF_IINCHIP_DBG__         
00595          printf("Illegal Channel(%d) RX Memory Size.\r\n",i);
00596       #endif
00597          return 0;
00598       }
00599       ssum += (uint16)tx_size[i];
00600       rsum += (uint16)rx_size[i];
00601       TXMEM_SIZE[i] = ((uint32)tx_size[i]) << 10;
00602       RXMEM_SIZE[i] = ((uint32)rx_size[i]) << 10;
00603    }
00604    if( (ssum % 8) || ((ssum + rsum) != 128) )
00605    {
00606    #ifdef __DEF_IINCHIP_DBG__
00607       printf("Illegal Memory Allocation\r\n");
00608    #endif
00609       return 0;
00610    }
00611    
00612    IINCHIP_WRITE(TMS01R,((uint16)tx_size[0] << 8) + (uint16)tx_size[1]);
00613    IINCHIP_WRITE(TMS23R,((uint16)tx_size[2] << 8) + (uint16)tx_size[3]);
00614    IINCHIP_WRITE(TMS45R,((uint16)tx_size[4] << 8) + (uint16)tx_size[5]);
00615    IINCHIP_WRITE(TMS67R,((uint16)tx_size[6] << 8) + (uint16)tx_size[7]);
00616    
00617    IINCHIP_WRITE(RMS01R,((uint16)rx_size[0] << 8) + (uint16)rx_size[1]);
00618    IINCHIP_WRITE(RMS23R,((uint16)rx_size[2] << 8) + (uint16)rx_size[3]);
00619    IINCHIP_WRITE(RMS45R,((uint16)rx_size[4] << 8) + (uint16)rx_size[5]);
00620    IINCHIP_WRITE(RMS67R,((uint16)rx_size[6] << 8) + (uint16)rx_size[7]);
00621    
00622    for(i=0; i <ssum/8 ; i++)
00623    {
00624       mem_cfg <<= 1;
00625       mem_cfg |= 1;
00626    }
00627    
00628    IINCHIP_WRITE(MTYPER,mem_cfg);
00629    
00630    #ifdef __DEF_IINCHIP_DBG__
00631       printf("Total TX Memory Size = %dKB\r\n",ssum);
00632       printf("Total RX Memory Size = %dKB\r\n",rsum);
00633       printf("Ch : TX SIZE : RECV SIZE\r\n");
00634       printf("%02d : %07dKB : %07dKB \r\n", 0, (uint8)(IINCHIP_READ(TMS01R)>>8),(uint8)(IINCHIP_READ(RMS01R)>>8));
00635       printf("%02d : %07dKB : %07dKB \r\n", 1, (uint8)IINCHIP_READ(TMS01R),(uint8)IINCHIP_READ(RMS01R));
00636       printf("%02d : %07dKB : %07dKB \r\n", 2, (uint8)(IINCHIP_READ(TMS23R)>>8),(uint8)(IINCHIP_READ(RMS23R)>>8));
00637       printf("%02d : %07dKB : %07dKB \r\n", 3, (uint8)IINCHIP_READ(TMS23R),(uint8)IINCHIP_READ(RMS23R));
00638       printf("%02d : %07dKB : %07dKB \r\n", 4, (uint8)(IINCHIP_READ(TMS45R)>>8),(uint8)(IINCHIP_READ(RMS45R)>>8));
00639       printf("%02d : %07dKB : %07dKB \r\n", 5, (uint8)IINCHIP_READ(TMS45R),(uint8)IINCHIP_READ(RMS45R));
00640       printf("%02d : %07dKB : %07dKB \r\n", 6, (uint8)(IINCHIP_READ(TMS67R)>>8),(uint8)(IINCHIP_READ(RMS67R)>>8));
00641       printf("%02d : %07dKB : %07dKB \r\n", 7, (uint8)IINCHIP_READ(TMS67R),(uint8)IINCHIP_READ(RMS67R));
00642       printf("\r\nMTYPER=%04x\r\n",IINCHIP_READ(MTYPER));
00643    #endif
00644    
00645    return 1;
00646 }
00647 
00648 uint32   wiz_write_buf(SOCKET s,uint8* buf,uint32 len)
00649 {
00650 #if (__DEF_IINCHIP_ADDRESS_MODE__ == __DEF_IINCHIP_DIRECT_MODE__)
00651    #if (__DEF_IINCHIP_BUF_OP__ == __DEF_C__) 
00652       uint32 idx=0;
00653       // M_08082008
00654       IINCHIP_CRITICAL_SECTION_ENTER();
00655       for (idx = 0; idx < len; idx+=2)
00656          IINCHIP_WRITE(Sn_TX_FIFOR(s),*((uint16*)(buf+idx))); 
00657       // M_08082008
00658       IINCHIP_CRITICAL_SECTION_EXIT();
00659    #elif (__DEF_IINCHIP_BUF_OP__ == __DEF_MCU_DEP_INLINE_ASM__)
00660       register uint16 data;
00661       register uint16 loop;
00662       loop = len;
00663       // M_08082008
00664       IINCHIP_CRITICAL_SECTION_ENTER();      
00665       __asm
00666       {
00667       fifo_write_loop:
00668         // ARM version
00669         LDRH    data, [buf], #2
00670         STRH    data, [Sn_TX_FIFOR(s)]
00671         SUBS    loop,loop, #2
00672         BNE     fifo_write_loop
00673       }
00674       // M_08082008
00675       IINCHIP_CRITICAL_SECTION_EXIT();       
00676    #elif (__DEF_IINCHIP_BUF_OP__ == __DEF_MCU_DEP_DMA__)
00677       #error "You should do implement this block."
00678    #endif
00679 #elif (__DEF_IINCHIP_ADDRESS_MODE__ == __DEF_IINCHIP_INDIRECT_MODE__)
00680    #if (__DEF_IINCHIP_BUF_OP__ == __DEF_C__) */
00681       uint32 idx=0;
00682       IINCHIP_CRITICAL_SECTION_ENTER();
00683       *((vuint16*)IDM_AR) = Sn_TX_FIFOR(s);
00684       for (idx = 0; idx < len; idx+=2)
00685           *((vuint16*)IDM_DR) = *((uint16*)(buf+idx));
00686       IINCHIP_CRITICAL_SECTION_EXIT();
00687    #elif (__DEF_IINCHIP_BUF_OP__ == __DEF_MCU_DEP_INLINE_ASM__)
00688       register uint16 data=0;
00689       register uint16 loop;
00690       loop = len;
00691       IINCHIP_CRITICAL_SECTION_ENTER();    
00692       *((vuint16*)IDM_AR) = Sn_TX_FIFOR(s);
00693       __asm
00694       {
00695       fifo_write_loop:
00696         // ARM version
00697         LDRH    data, [buf], #2
00698         STRH    data, [IDM_DR]
00699         SUBS    loop,loop, #2
00700         BNE     fifo_write_loop      
00701       }
00702       IINCHIP_CRITICAL_SECTION_EXIT();
00703    #elif (__DEF_IINCHIP_BUF_OP__ == __DEF_MCU_DEP_DMA__)
00704       #error "You should do implement this block."
00705    #else
00706       #error "Undefined __DEF_IINCHIP_BUF_OP__"
00707    #endif 
00708 #else
00709    #error "Undefined __DEF_IINCHIP_ADDRESS_MODE__"   
00710 #endif
00711     return len;   
00712 }
00713 
00714 uint32   wiz_read_buf(SOCKET s, uint8* buf,uint32 len)
00715 {
00716 #if (__DEF_IINCHIP_ADDRESS_MODE__ == __DEF_IINCHIP_DIRECT_MODE__)
00717    #if (__DEF_IINCHIP_BUF_OP__ == __DEF_C__)
00718       uint32 idx;
00719       // M_08082008 
00720       IINCHIP_CRITICAL_SECTION_ENTER();
00721       for (idx = 0; idx < len; idx+=2)
00722          *((uint16*)(buf+idx)) = IINCHIP_READ(Sn_RX_FIFOR(s));
00723       // M_08082008   
00724       IINCHIP_CRITICAL_SECTION_EXIT();
00725    #elif (__DEF_IINCHIP_BUF_OP__ == __DEF_MCU_DEP_INLINE_ASM__)
00726       register uint16 data=0;
00727       register int16 loop;
00728       loop = (int16) len;
00729       // M_08082008
00730       IINCHIP_CRITICAL_SECTION_ENTER();
00731       __asm
00732       {
00733       fifo_read_loop:
00734         // ARM version
00735         LDRH    data, [Sn_RX_FIFOR(s)]
00736         STRH    data, [buf], #2
00737         SUBS    loop,loop, #2
00738         BNE     fifo_read_loop
00739       }
00740       // M_08082008
00741       IINCHIP_CRITICAL_SECTION_EXIT();
00742    #elif (__DEF_IINCHIP_BUF_OP__ == __DEF_MCU_DEP_DMA__)
00743       #error "You should do implement this block."
00744    #else
00745       #error "Undefined __DEF_IINCHIP_BUF_OP__"
00746    #endif 
00747 #elif (__DEF_IINCHIP_ADDRESS_MODE__ == __DEF_IINCHIP_INDIRECT_MODE__)
00748    #if (__DEF_IINCHIP_BUF_OP__ == __DEF_C__) */
00749       uint32 idx=0;
00750       IINCHIP_CRITICAL_SECTION_ENTER();
00751       *((vuint16*)IDM_AR) = Sn_RX_FIFOR(s);
00752       for (idx = 0; idx < len; idx+=2)
00753          *((uint16*)(buf+idx)) = *((vuint16*)IDM_DR);
00754       IINCHIP_CRITICAL_SECTION_EXIT();
00755    #elif (__DEF_IINCHIP_BUF_OP__ == __DEF_MCU_DEP_INLINE_ASM__)
00756       register uint16 data=0;
00757       register int16 loop;
00758       loop = (int16)len;
00759       IINCHIP_CRITICAL_SECTION_ENTER();      
00760       *((vuint16*)IDM_AR) = Sn_RX_FIFOR(s);
00761       __asm
00762       {
00763       fifo_read_loop:
00764         // ARM version
00765         LDRH    data, [IDM_DR]
00766         STRH    data, [buf], #2
00767         SUBS    loop,loop, #2
00768         BNE     fifo_read_loop      
00769       }
00770       IINCHIP_CRITICAL_SECTION_EXIT();
00771    #elif (__DEF_IINCHIP_BUF_OP__ == __DEF_MCU_DEP_DMA__)
00772       #error "You should do implement this block."
00773    #else
00774       #error "Undefined __DEF_IINCHIP_BUF_OP__"
00775    #endif 
00776 #else
00777    #error "Undefined __DEF_IINCHIP_ADDRESS_MODE__"   
00778 #endif
00779     return len;
00780 }
00781 
00782 
00783 uint32   getIINCHIP_TxMAX(SOCKET s)
00784 {
00785    return TXMEM_SIZE[s];
00786 }
00787 
00788 uint32   getIINCHIP_RxMAX(SOCKET s)
00789 {
00790    return RXMEM_SIZE[s];
00791 }
00792 
00793 
00794 // This statement is commented for using 'Doxygen'.
00795 //#ifdef __DEF_IINCHIP_PPP__
00796 
00800 #define PPP_OPTION_BUF_LEN 64 
00801 
00821 uint8    pppinit_in(uint8 * id, uint8 idlen, uint8 * passwd, uint8 passwdlen)
00822 {
00823    uint8 loop_idx = 0;
00824    uint8 isr = 0;
00825    uint8 buf[PPP_OPTION_BUF_LEN];
00826    uint32 len;
00827    uint8 str[PPP_OPTION_BUF_LEN];
00828    uint8 str_idx,dst_idx;
00829    
00831    // PHASE1. PPPoE Discovery //
00833    // start to connect pppoe connection
00834    printf("-- PHASE 1. PPPoE Discovery process --");
00835    printf(" ok\r\n");
00836    printf("\r\n");
00837    setSn_CR(0,Sn_CR_PCON);
00838    wait_10ms(100);
00839    
00840    // check if PPPoE discovery phase is success or not
00841    loop_idx = 0;
00842    while (!(getSn_IR(0) & Sn_IR_PNEXT)) 
00843    {
00844       printf(".");
00845       if (loop_idx++ == 10) // timeout
00846       {
00847          printf("timeout before LCP\r\n"); 
00848          return 3;
00849       }
00850       wait_10ms(100);
00851    }
00852    setSn_IR(0,Sn_IR_PNEXT);
00853    
00855    // PHASE2. LCP process //
00857    printf("-- PHASE 2. LCP process --");
00858    {
00859       // Magic number option
00860       // option format (type value + length value + data)
00861       // write magic number value
00862       buf[0] = 0x05; // type value
00863       buf[1] = 0x06; // length value
00864       buf[2] = 0x01; buf[3] = 0x01; buf[4] = 0x01; buf[5]= 0x01; // data
00865       // for MRU option, 1492 0x05d4  
00866       // buf[6] = 0x01; buf[7] = 0x04; buf[8] = 0x05; buf[9] = 0xD4;
00867    }
00868    wiz_write_buf(0,buf, 0x06);
00869    setSn_TX_WRSR(0,0x06);
00870    setSn_CR(0,Sn_CR_PCR); // send LCP request to PPPoE server
00871    wait_10ms(100);
00872    
00873    while (!((isr = getSn_IR(0)) & Sn_IR_PNEXT))
00874    {
00875       if (isr & Sn_IR_PRECV)     // Not support option
00876       {
00877          len = getSn_RX_RSR(0);
00878          if ( len > 2 )
00879          {
00880             wiz_read_buf(0,str, 2);
00881             len = ((uint16)str[0] << 8) + str[1];
00882             wiz_read_buf(0,(str+2), len);
00883             setSn_CR(0,Sn_CR_RECV);
00884             // get option length
00885             len = (uint32)str[4]; len = ((len & 0xff) << 8) + (uint32)str[5];
00886             len += 2;
00887             str_idx = 6; dst_idx = 0; // PPP header is 6 byte, so starts at 6.
00888             do 
00889             {
00890                if ((str[str_idx] == 0x01) || (str[str_idx] == 0x02) || (str[str_idx] == 0x03) || (str[str_idx] == 0x05))
00891                {
00892                   // skip as length of support option. str_idx+1 is option's length.
00893                   str_idx += str[str_idx+1];
00894                }
00895                else
00896                {
00897                   // not support option , REJECT
00898                   memcpy((uint8 *)(buf+dst_idx), (uint8 *)(str+str_idx), str[str_idx+1]);
00899                   dst_idx += str[str_idx+1]; str_idx += str[str_idx+1];
00900                }
00901             } while (str_idx != len);
00902          
00903             // send LCP REJECT packet
00904             wiz_write_buf(0,buf, dst_idx);
00905             setSn_TX_WRSR(0,dst_idx);
00906             setSn_CR(0,Sn_CR_PCJ);
00907             setSn_IR(0,Sn_IR_PRECV);
00908          }
00909       }
00910       printf(".");
00911       if (loop_idx++ == 10) // timeout
00912       {
00913          printf("timeout after LCP\r\n");
00914          return 3;
00915       }
00916       wait_10ms(100);
00917    }
00918    setSn_IR(0,Sn_IR_PNEXT);
00919    printf(" ok\r\n");
00920    printf("\r\n");
00921 
00923    // PHASE 3. PPPoE Authentication //
00925    printf("-- PHASE 3. PPPoE Authentication mode --\r\n");
00926    printf("Authentication protocol : %04x, ", getPATR());
00927    loop_idx = 0;
00928    if (getPATR() == 0xC023)         // PAP type
00929    {
00930       printf("PAP\r\n"); // in case of adsl normally supports PAP.
00931       // send authentication data
00932       // copy (idlen + id + passwdlen + passwd)
00933       buf[loop_idx] = idlen; loop_idx++;
00934       memcpy((uint8 *)(buf+loop_idx), (uint8 *)(id), idlen); loop_idx += idlen;
00935       buf[loop_idx] = passwdlen; loop_idx++;
00936       memcpy((uint8 *)(buf+loop_idx), (uint8 *)(passwd), passwdlen); loop_idx += passwdlen;
00937       wiz_write_buf(0,buf, loop_idx);
00938       setSn_TX_WRSR(0,loop_idx);
00939       setSn_CR(0,Sn_CR_PCR);
00940       wait_10ms(100);
00941    }
00942    else if (getPATR() == 0xC223)    // CHAP type
00943    {
00944       uint8 chal_len;
00945       md5_ctx context;
00946       uint8  digest[16];
00947       
00948       len = getSn_RX_RSR(0);
00949       if ( len > 2 )
00950       {
00951          wiz_read_buf(0,str,2);
00952          len = ((uint32)str[0] << 8) + (uint32)str[1];
00953          wiz_read_buf(0, str, len);
00954          setSn_CR(0,Sn_CR_RECV);
00955          #ifdef __DEF_IINCHIP_DBG__
00956          {
00957             int16 i;
00958             printf("recv CHAP\r\n");
00959             for (i = 0; i < 32; i++) printf ("%02X ", str[i]);
00960             printf("\r\n");
00961          }
00962          #endif
00963          // str is C2 23 xx CHAL_ID xx xx CHAP_LEN CHAP_DATA
00964          // index  0  1  2  3       4  5  6        7 ...
00965          
00966          memset(buf,0x00,64);
00967          buf[loop_idx] = str[3]; loop_idx++; // chal_id
00968          memcpy((uint8 *)(buf+loop_idx), (uint8 *)(passwd), passwdlen); loop_idx += passwdlen; //passwd
00969          chal_len = str[6]; // chal_id
00970          memcpy((uint8 *)(buf+loop_idx), (uint8 *)(str+7), chal_len); loop_idx += chal_len; //challenge
00971          buf[loop_idx] = 0x80;
00972          #ifdef __DEF_IINCHIP_DBG__
00973          {
00974             int16 i;
00975             printf("CHAP proc d1\r\n");
00976             
00977             for (i = 0; i < 64; i++) printf ("%02X ", buf[i]);
00978             printf("\r\n");
00979          }
00980          #endif
00981          
00982          md5_init(&context);
00983          md5_update(&context, buf, loop_idx);
00984          md5_final(digest, &context);
00985          
00986          #ifdef __DEF_IINCHIP_DBG__
00987          {
00988             uint i;
00989             printf("CHAP proc d1\r\n");
00990             for (i = 0; i < 16; i++) printf ("%02X", digest[i]);
00991             printf("\r\n");
00992          }
00993          #endif
00994          loop_idx = 0;
00995          buf[loop_idx] = 16; loop_idx++; // hash_len
00996          memcpy((uint8 *)(buf+loop_idx), (uint8 *)(digest), 16); loop_idx += 16; // hashed value
00997          memcpy((uint8 *)(buf+loop_idx), (uint8 *)(id), idlen); loop_idx += idlen; // id
00998          wiz_write_buf(0,buf, loop_idx);
00999          setSn_TX_WRSR(0,loop_idx);
01000          setSn_CR(0,Sn_CR_PCR);
01001          wait_10ms(100);
01002       }
01003    }
01004    else
01005    {
01006       printf("Not support\r\n");
01007       #ifdef __DEF_IINCHIP_DBG__
01008          printf("Not support PPP Auth type: %.4x\r\n",getPATR());
01009       #endif
01010       return 4;
01011    }
01012    printf("\r\n");
01013    
01014    printf("-- Waiting for PPPoE server's admission --");
01015    loop_idx = 0;
01016    while (!((isr = getSn_IR(0)) & Sn_IR_PNEXT))
01017    {
01018       if (isr & Sn_IR_PFAIL)
01019       {
01020          printf("failed\r\nReinput id, password..\r\n");
01021          return 2;
01022       }
01023       printf(".");
01024       if (loop_idx++ == 10) // timeout
01025       {
01026          printf("timeout after PAP\r\n");
01027          return 3;
01028       }
01029       wait_10ms(100);
01030    }
01031    setSn_IR(0,Sn_IR_PNEXT);
01032    printf("ok\r\n");
01033    printf("\r\n");
01034 
01036    // PHASE 4. IPCP process //
01038    printf("-- PHASE 4. IPCP process --");
01039    // IP Address
01040    buf[0] = 0x03; buf[1] = 0x06; buf[2] = 0x00; buf[3] = 0x00; buf[4] = 0x00; buf[5] = 0x00;
01041    wiz_write_buf(0,buf, 6);
01042    setSn_TX_WRSR(0,6);
01043    setSn_CR(0,Sn_CR_PCR);
01044    wait_10ms(100);
01045    
01046    loop_idx = 0;
01047    while (1)
01048    {
01049       if (getSn_IR(0) & Sn_IR_PRECV)
01050       {
01051          len = getSn_RX_RSR(0);
01052          if ( len > 2 )
01053          {
01054             wiz_read_buf(0,str,2);
01055             len = ((uint32)str[0] << 8) + (uint32)str[1];
01056             wiz_read_buf(0, str, len);
01057             setSn_CR(0,Sn_CR_RECV);
01058             str_idx = 6; dst_idx = 0;
01059             if (str[2] == 0x03) // in case of NAK
01060             {
01061                do 
01062                {
01063                   if (str[str_idx] == 0x03) // request only ip information
01064                   {
01065                      memcpy((uint8 *)(buf+dst_idx), (uint8 *)(str+str_idx), str[str_idx+1]);
01066                      dst_idx += str[str_idx+1]; str_idx += str[str_idx+1];
01067                   }
01068                   else
01069                   {
01070                      // skip byte
01071                      str_idx += str[str_idx+1];
01072                   }
01073                   // for debug
01074                   //printf("s: %d, d: %d, l: %d", str_idx, dst_idx, len);
01075                } while (str_idx != len);
01076                wiz_write_buf(0,buf, dst_idx);
01077                setSn_TX_WRSR(0,dst_idx);
01078                setSn_CR(0,Sn_CR_PCR); // send ipcp request
01079                wait_10ms(100);
01080                break;
01081             }
01082          }
01083          setSn_IR(0,Sn_IR_PRECV);
01084       }
01085       printf(".");
01086       if (loop_idx++ == 10) // timeout
01087       {
01088          printf("timeout after IPCP\r\n");
01089          return 3;
01090       }
01091       wait_10ms(100);
01092       wiz_write_buf(0, buf, 6);
01093       setSn_TX_WRSR(0,6);
01094       setSn_CR(0,Sn_CR_PCR); //ipcp re-request
01095    }
01096    
01097    loop_idx = 0;
01098    while (!(getSn_IR(0) & Sn_IR_PNEXT))
01099    {
01100       printf(".");
01101       if (loop_idx++ == 10) // timeout
01102       {
01103          printf("timeout after IPCP NAK\r\n");
01104          return 3;
01105       }
01106       wait_10ms(100);
01107       setSn_CR(0,Sn_CR_PCR); // send ipcp request
01108    }
01109    setSn_IR(0,Sn_IR_PNEXT);
01110    printf("ok\r\n");
01111    printf("\r\n");
01112    return 1;
01113    // after this function, the pppoe server's mac address and pppoe session id is saved in PHAR and PSIDR repectly.
01114 }
01115 
01116 uint8    pppinit(uint8 *id, uint8 idlen, uint8 *passwd, uint8 passwdlen)
01117 {
01118         uint8 ret;
01119         uint8 isr;
01120         
01121         // PHASE0. PPPoE setup
01122 
01123         printf("-- PHASE 0. PPPoE setup process --\r\n");
01124         printf("\r\n");
01125         setMR(getMR()|MR_PPPoE);                     // set PPPoE mode
01126         setMR(getMR()|MR_FS);                        // If little-endian, set MR_FS. Otherwise, comment. 
01127 
01128         isr =  getSn_IR(0);
01129         setSn_IR(0,(uint16)isr);                     // clear the previous value of Sn_IR(0)   
01130         
01131         setPTIMER(200);                              // set LPC request time to 5 seconds
01132         setPMAGICR(0x01);                            // set the magic number
01133         setSn_MR(0, Sn_MR_PPPoE);                    // set Sn_MR(0) to PPPoE mode
01134         setSn_CR(0,Sn_CR_OPEN);                      //open SOCKET0 with PPPoE mode                      
01135         
01136         ret = pppinit_in(id, idlen, passwd, passwdlen); // process the PPPoE message
01137 
01138         setSn_CR(0, Sn_CR_CLOSE);                       // close PPPoE SOCKET0
01139 
01140         return ret;   
01141 }
01142    
01143 void    pppterm(uint8 *mac, uint16 sessionid)
01144 {
01145    uint8 isr;
01146    #ifdef __DEF_IINCHIP_DBG__
01147       printf("pppterm()\r\n");
01148    #endif
01149    
01150    // set PPPoE mode
01151    setMR(getMR() | MR_PPPoE);                
01152    
01153    // set pppoe server's mac address and session id 
01154    // must be setted these value.
01155    setSn_DHAR(0, mac);
01156    setSn_DPORTR(0,sessionid);
01157 
01158    // clear the previous value of Sn_IR(0) 
01159         isr =  getSn_IR(0);
01160         setSn_IR(0,(uint16)isr);                  
01161    
01162    //open SOCKET0 with PPPoE mode
01163         setSn_MR(0, Sn_MR_PPPoE);                    
01164         setSn_CR(0,Sn_CR_OPEN);                      
01165    while(getSn_SSR(0) != SOCK_PPPoE)            
01166    
01167    // close PPPoE connection
01168    setSn_CR(0,Sn_CR_PDISCON);
01169    wait_10ms(100);
01170    // close socket
01171    setSn_CR(0,Sn_CR_CLOSE);
01172    
01173    #ifdef __DEF_IINCHIP_DBG__
01174       printf("pppterm() end ..\r\n");
01175    #endif
01176 }
01177 // This statement is commented for using 'Doxygen'.
01178 //#endif
01179 
01180 
01181 void  wait_1us(uint32 us)
01182 {
01183    uint32 i,j;
01184    for(i = 0; i < us ; i++)
01185    {
01186       for(j = 0; j < 100; j++);
01187    }
01188 }
01189 
01190 void  wait_1ms(uint32 ms)
01191 {
01192    uint32 i;
01193    for(i = 0; i < ms ; i++)
01194    {
01195      wait_1us(1000);
01196    }
01197    
01198 }
01199 
01200 void  wait_10ms(uint32 ms)
01201 {
01202    uint32 i;
01203    for(i = 0; i < ms ; i++)
01204    {
01205      wait_1ms(10);
